articles.headline: Hungry for Energy, Amazon, Google and Microsoft Turn to Nuclear Power
articles.snippet: Large technology companies are investing billions of dollars in nuclear energy as an emissions-free source of electricity for artificial intelligence and other businesses.
articles.abstract: Large technology companies are investing billions of dollars in nuclear energy as an emissions-free source of electricity for artificial intelligence and other businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Technology companies are increasingly looking to nuclear power plants to provide the emissions-free electricity needed to run artificial intelligence and other businesses.
articles.byline: By Ivan Penn and Karen Weise

articles.headline: Alone in the Dark: The Nightmare of Bangladesh’s Secret Underground Prison
articles.snippet: In the House of Mirrors, political captives were pushed to the brink of insanity and death. Some are telling their stories now that the woman who put them there, Sheikh Hasina, is gone.
articles.abstract: In the House of Mirrors, political captives were pushed to the brink of insanity and death. Some are telling their stories now that the woman who put them there, Sheikh Hasina, is gone.
articles.lead_paragraph: When his jailers barged in before dawn, the captive thought it was the end.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal, Shayeza Walid and Atul Loke

articles.headline: Inside the Secretive $700 Million Ad-Testing Factory for Kamala Harris
articles.snippet: Future Forward has ascended to the top of the Democratic political universe, but it has also drawn suspicion and second-guessing.
articles.abstract: Future Forward has ascended to the top of the Democratic political universe, but it has also drawn suspicion and second-guessing.
articles.lead_paragraph: The biggest super PAC in American politics is in the middle of an unparalleled spending spree, unleashing more money on television advertising in the closing weeks of the 2024 race than the campaigns of Donald J. Trump and Kamala Harris combined.
articles.byline: By Theodore Schleifer and Shane Goldmacher

articles.headline: Door Knocking Is Tough These Days. Harris’s Team Is Betting on Apps.
articles.snippet: As technology like doorbell cameras makes it easier to avoid unsolicited visitors, the Harris campaign is leaning on data-capturing apps to supplement the traditional work of canvassing.
articles.abstract: As technology like doorbell cameras makes it easier to avoid unsolicited visitors, the Harris campaign is leaning on data-capturing apps to supplement the traditional work of canvassing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Clutching a fistful of Harris campaign pamphlets, George Pumphrey Jr. hunched in front of a doorbell camera in a neighborhood in North Milwaukee and began yelling into the little digital peephole.

articles.headline: White House, Used to Road Blocks on Student Debt, Finds Cause for Victory Lap
articles.snippet: An effort to revive and maximize use of the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program has resulted in student loan forgiveness for over one million people.
articles.abstract: An effort to revive and maximize use of the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program has resulted in student loan forgiveness for over one million people.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration has reached a major milestone in its pursuit of expansive student debt relief, announcing on Thursday that over one million people have had their federal student debt canceled through a program that offers forgiveness to public service workers.

articles.headline: This Ring on Your Finger Tracks Your Sleep. Is It Worth the Splurge?
articles.snippet: The $350 Oura Ring 4 looks sleek and cool, and it may be useful for data-hungry health enthusiasts. But it failed this sleep-deprived parent.
articles.abstract: The $350 Oura Ring 4 looks sleek and cool, and it may be useful for data-hungry health enthusiasts. But it failed this sleep-deprived parent.
articles.lead_paragraph: How much would you pay for a good night’s sleep?

articles.headline: Electric Vehicles May Be Struggling. G.M.’s Leader Is Still a Believer.
articles.snippet: Mary Barra, G.M.’s chief executive, said that the company had fixed battery-manufacturing problems and that its electric vehicles would soon be profitable.
articles.abstract: Mary Barra, G.M.’s chief executive, said that the company had fixed battery-manufacturing problems and that its electric vehicles would soon be profitable.
articles.lead_paragraph: Electric vehicles have had a hard year. Sales have been disappointing. Former President Donald J. Trump has regularly disparaged them. And even many environmentally conscious car buyers have been choosing hybrids instead.

articles.headline: Trump Keeps Promising New Tax Cuts. Other Republicans Are Wary.
articles.snippet: Former President Donald J. Trump’s costly tax agenda undermines the changes he signed into law in 2017. Some Republicans are wary.
articles.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump’s costly tax agenda undermines the changes he signed into law in 2017. Some Republicans are wary.
articles.lead_paragraph: When former President Donald J. Trump started proposing new tax cuts on the campaign trail, pledging “no taxes on tips” in June, Republicans rallied around his idea. Even Vice President Kamala Harris, his Democratic rival, copied it.
